meanings.definition: The quality or state of being severable.
meanings.sent1: The severability of the fabric allowed the tailor to easily cut it into pieces.
meanings.sent2: The legal document included a clause about the severability of its provisions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the severability of the rope to create the illusion of two separate pieces.
meanings.sent4: The severability of the cake into individual slices symbolized the sharing of joy among friends.
meanings.sent5: The severability of the puzzle pieces made it easier for the child to solve the jigsaw.

meanings.definition: The ability to be separated or divided.
meanings.sent1: The severability of the two magnets allowed them to be pulled apart easily.
meanings.sent2: During the renovation, the wall's severability was tested to determine if it could be taken down.
meanings.sent3: The severability of the cookie into halves sparked a playful argument over who got the bigger piece.
meanings.sent4: The severability of the relationship between the two countries was evident in their differing political views.
meanings.sent5: The severability of the chain links made it simple to repair the broken necklace.
